intro: Tribulus pterophorus, commonly known as the spurred calotropis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its distinctive spurred calyces on its flowers. The plant has hairy, branching stems and produces yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically opposite and have a lobed or heart-shaped appearance. Tribulus pterophorus is often found in arid or semi-arid regions and is adapted to thrive in poor soil conditions.
